column4: can anyone tell me how to change my ip address using ifconfig? i've tried restarting the networking services but it doesn't seem to try to pull dhcp
change your ip? You mean your internal IP address?
- yes - right now it's got an ipv6 address setup that doesn't help me; i need it to get online (dns isn't important in my case)
are you trying to get a static IP or are you using DHCP ?
- i would like ot use dhcp, but if that doesn't work i don't mind setting it to a static ip address [i'm using the live cd to get some data off of another hard drive that windows doesn't like]
are you running gnome ?
- no, that mcahine doesn't like X
did you try ifup eth0 ?
- yes
hmmm ... are you sure that is the correct device ... try ifup eth1
- there is no eth1, it's only th eloopbackup and eth0
oh k. Well, I dunno then. I'd have to know a bit more about your internal network settings to try to troubleshoot
- what is it you need to know? i know the pool range...theres nothing else to know...
what is your ip range ... and do you know which IPs are already taken ?
- i know everything that's taken; i can use anything from 2 to about 100, but i'm oging with 88
- can you help me in this case?
- did you log in?
it connected me automoatically it seemed ... but ...
did you receive my private messages ?
- did you receive mine..?
errr ... no ...
- http://pastebin.com/762637
so there's no way to get pass that huh ?
